question_text: What is the purpose of SPF in email systems?
answer_options: To assign IP addresses to clients
To detect and prevent phishing emails through digital signatures
To specify which mail servers are authorized to send mail for a domain
To encrypt email messages in transit
correct_answer: To specify which mail servers are authorized to send mail for a domain
explanation: SPF (Sender Policy Framework) is used to prevent spoofing by identifying the mail servers allowed to send email on behalf of a domain.
